intro: Hosackia heermannii, commonly known as the Heermann's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers in late spring. It is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Hosackia heermannii is often used in restoration projects due to its drought tolerance and ecological benefits.
